data.title: B&Q Hull - Ferry Lane
data.meta_description: Disabled Accessibility Guide for B&Q Hull - Ferry Lane in B&Q providing accessible disability and wheelchair friendly information
data.text:
Access Guide

Show Easy Read

Easy Read

Search Access Guide

Summary

This guide was created in July 2023.

There are no public transport links within 200m of the venue.

The venue has its own parking.

A designated drop off point is not available.

The most accessible entrance is the TradePoint entrance.

There is step free access at this entrance.

There is step-free access throughout the building.

There is not a designated safe place which can be used by people who may feel scared or at risk.

Accessible toilet facilities are available.

Step-free ambulant toilet facilities are not available.

Step-free standard toilet facilities are not available.

Baby change facilities are available.

Left hand transfer accessible toilet facilities can be found at the front right of the store, next to the trade entrance.

Baby changing facilities can be found within the accessible toilet, at the front right of the store, next to the trade entrance.

Getting Help and Assistance

Click + Collect is available at this store.

The Click + Collect point is located at the front of the store, to the right as you enter via the main entrance.

There is a collection point available at this store.

The collection point is located at the front of the store to the right as you enter via the main entrance.

The following are available to borrow: wheelchairs.

The types of trolley available at this store include: standard, standard with baby seat, wheelchair attachable, board carrier (A-frame), heavy duty (heavy garden), flat-bed and wheeled basket.

An assistance dog toilet or toileting area is available at the store.

The assistance dog toilet or toileting area can be found on the grass areas around the car park.

Water bowls for assistance dogs are available.

Public Transport

Please click here for opening times and directions to this store.

There is not a bus stop within approximately 150m of the venue.

The nearest bus stop is located on Ann Watson Street.

The nearest train station is Hull.

For more information on Hull Station please click here (opens new tab).

Parking

The store has its own parking facilities which do not need to be booked in advance.

Blue Badge parking is available.

Blue Badge parking is clearly marked and signed.

The nearest designated Blue Badge parking bay is approximately 5m from the main entrance.

The car park is free for all users.

Clearly marked and signed parent and child parking bays are not.

There are no Load and Go parking spaces available.

Parking View

The car park is located in front of the store.

The car park type is open air/surface.

The car park surface is tarmac.

Parking spaces are provided on a first come first serve basis.

Blue Badge Parking View

There are more than 10 Blue Badge parking bays.

The dimensions of the Blue Badge bays are 200cm x 460cm.

There is a hatched zone on both sides and to the rear.

The hatched zone is less than 120cm.

Access from the Car Park View

The entrance is clearly visible from the car park.

Potential obstacles between the Blue Badge parking and the entrance include dropped kerbs without tactile paving.

Approach (Main Entrance)

The surface of the approach is block paving.

There are bollards on the approach which have a minimum width of 105cm and are 77cm high.

The bollards contrast visually with the paving.

There is step-free access on approach.

Entrance

This information is for the entrance located at the front left of the store.

The entrance area/door is clearly signed.

There is not a canopy or recess which provides weather protection at this entrance.

There is a dark mat or floor marking at this entrance that might be perceived as a hole.

A colleague is available at this entrance to assist customers.

There is ramped/sloped access at this entrance.

There is a slope with a steep gradient and a width of at least 150cm .

The slope does not have handrails.

There are double automatic doors which open by sliding.

The width of the opening is 188cm.

There is a second set of doors.

There are double automatic doors which open by sliding.

The width of the opening is 241cm.

There are security barriers immediately beyond the entrance.

Entrance (TradePoint)

This information is for the entrance located at the front right of the store.

The entrance area/door is clearly signed.

There is a canopy or recess which provides weather protection at this entrance.

A colleague is available at this entrance to assist customers.

There is step-free access at this entrance.

There is an open entrance.

The width of the opening is 360cm.

There are security barriers immediately beyond the entrance.

Shop

There is step-free access throughout the shop.

The lighting levels in the shop are good.

Wayfinding signage is provided.

The colour, design and typeface of signs is consistent throughout the shop.

All flooring in the shop is smooth and even.

The flooring has a very shiny finish which may cause glare or look slippery to some people.

The majority of aisle widths are 150cm+.

Access throughout the shop is unobstructed.

There is high colour contrast between the shelving and floor in the majority of walkways.

There is background noise in the shop.

Counter (Collections)

The counter is located at the front of the store, to the right as you enter.

The counter is approximately 15m from the main entrance.

Clear signage for the counter is visible from the entrance.

There is step-free access to the counter.

The counter is placed in front of a patterned background.

The lighting levels at the counter are good.

The counter is 106cm high.

The counter for seated users is 84cm high.

There is sufficient space to write or sign documents on the counter.

The counter for seated users has sufficient space to write or sign documents and a clear knee recess.

The counter does not have a hearing assistance system.

Counter (Paint Mixing)

The counter is located in the centre of the store.

The counter is approximately 30m from the main entrance.

Clear signage for the counter is not visible from the entrance.

There is step-free access to the counter.

The lighting levels at the counter are good.

The counter is 106cm high.

The counter for seated users is 76cm high.

There is an assistance button which is 85cm from the floor.

The counter does not have a hearing assistance system.

Counter (Timber Cutting)

The counter is located at the right centre of the store.

The counter is approximately 80m from the main entrance.

Clear signage for the counter is not visible from the entrance.

There is step-free access to the counter.

The lighting levels at the counter are good.

The counter is 106cm high.

There is an assistance button which is 115cm from the floor.

The counter does not have a hearing assistance system.

Counter (TradePoint - Pay and Collect)

The counter is located to the left as you enter via the TradePoint entrance.

The counter is approximately 1m from the TradePoint entrance.

The counter is visible from the entrance.

There is step-free access to the counter.

The counter has windows, TVs, glazed screens or mirrors which could adversely affect the ability of someone to lip read.

The lighting levels at the counter are good.

The counter is 93cm high.

There is sufficient space to write or sign documents on the counter.

The counter does not have a hearing assistance system.

Counter (TradePoint - Order and Collect)

The counter is located to the left as you enter via the TradePoint entrance.

The counter is approximately 5m from the TradePoint entrance.

The counter is visible from the entrance.

There is step-free access to the counter.

The counter has windows, TVs, glazed screens or mirrors which could adversely affect the ability of someone to lip read.

The lighting levels at the counter are good.

The counter is 108cm high.

There is not sufficient space to write or sign documents on the counter.

The counter does not have a hearing assistance system.

Planning Area

The planning area is located in the centre of the store.

There is step-free access to the planning area.

The lighting levels in the planning area are good.

The distance between the floor and the lowest desk is 81cm.

The distance between the floor and the highest desk is 103cm.

There is sufficient space to write or sign documents on the desk.

The area does not have a hearing assistance system.

There are seats which do not have armrests.

There is sufficient space for a wheelchair user to use the planning area.

Area (Garden Centre)

The area is external.

This area can be found at the left of the store.

There are double automatic doors which open by sliding to access this area from the shop.

The width of the door opening is 152cm.

There is step-free access throughout the area.

Wayfinding signage is not provided.

The majority of aisle widths are 150cm+.

There is low colour contrast between the shelving and floor in the majority of walkways.

There is background noise in the area.

Checkouts

The checkout area is located at the front centre of the store.

There is step-free access to the checkout area.

The checkout area is clearly signed.

The lighting levels at the checkout area are good.

The store has: staffed checkouts and self-service checkouts.

Staffed Checkout(s) View

The staffed checkout has windows, TVs, glazed screens or mirrors which could adversely affect the ability of someone to lip read.

The checkout is 103cm high.

The Chip & PIN card machines are accessible to a wheelchair user from the staffed checkouts.

The checkout does not have a hearing assistance system.

Self-Service Checkout(s) View

The controls/screen heights for the self-service checkouts vary between 85cm and 150cm.

The Chip & PIN card machines are accessible to a wheelchair user from the self-service checkouts.

There is a hand-held scanner.

Colleagues can provide assistance with using the self-service checkouts.

Toilet with Adaptations (Left Hand Transfer)

This accessible toilet is located at the front right of the store, next to the TradePoint entrance.

This accessible toilet is approximately 45m from the main entrance.

There is step-free access into the accessible toilet.

Potential obstacles to the accessible toilet include security barriers.

The security barriers have a width of 110cm.

There is Braille, tactile, pictorial and written text signage on or near the toilet door.

There is a manual door which opens outwards and has a low colour contrast.

The width of the accessible toilet door opening is 82cm.

The door has a sliding bolt lock.

No key is required for the accessible toilet.

The dimensions of the cubicle are 225cm x 245cm and it has a turning space of at least 150cm x 150cm.

There is a lateral transfer space to the left of the toilet.

The lateral transfer space is 149cm (from the side of the toilet pan to the wall).

There is a spatula flush on the non transfer side.

There is a lid attached to the toilet seat.

The height of the toilet seat above floor level is 43cm.

The toilet has a backrest to lean back against.

The following fixtures can be reached from the toilet seat: the toilet roll holder.

The following fixtures cannot be reached from the toilet seat: the wash basin, the soap dispenser and the hand dryer.

The height of the toilet roll holder is 126cm.

The following grab rails are available: a horizontal grab rail on the non transfer side, a vertical grab rail on the transfer side and a horizontal grab rail on the door.

There is a dropdown rail on the transfer side.

The following have a high colour contrast with their surroundings: the floor and the internal door.

The following have a less clear colour contrast with their surroundings: the hand dryer, the toilet roll holder, the dropdown rail and all grab rails.

There is a pull cord emergency alarm at a recommended height.

The height of the wash basin is 74cm.

The wash basin tap type is lever.

The height of the soap dispenser is 95cm.

The height of the hand dryer is 102cm.

There is not a shelf.

The cubicle also has: a sanitary bin and a nappy/incontinence items bin.

The cubicle does not have a full length mirror and coat hooks.

Baby Changing Facilities View

There is a flip down baby change table available at a height of 93cm.

Standard Toilet

There is no standard toilet, but the accessible toilet can be used by everyone.

Exit

This information is for the exit located at the front centre of the store, just past the checkouts.

The exit area/door is clearly signed.

There are security barriers before the exit.

A colleague is available at this exit to assist customers.

There is step-free access at this exit.

There are double automatic doors which open by sliding.

The width of the opening is 204cm.

There is a second set of doors.

The second set of doors are double automatic doors which open by sliding.

The width of the opening is 157cm.

There is not a canopy or recess which provides weather protection at this exit for those awaiting pick up.

There are bollards with high colour contrast but no visual identification band beyond the exit.

The minimum width between the bollards is 105cm.
